fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40279].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Create a saved filter without favoriting it.
# Go to Manage Filter and edit the filter created in step 1 (Cog icon > Edit).
# At this moment the 'star' is already highlighted by default, despite the filter is not favorited yet. Click on the 'star' to favorite the filter.
# Save

h3. Expected Results:

The filter is favorited.

h3. Actual Results:

The filter is still not favorited.

h3. Workaround:

Favorite the filter directly from the list of filters.
fields.summary: Favorite icon does not function on the Edit Current Filter screen

Link custom fields from different issues on JIRA
Improve Documentation For JIRA Importer (JIM) Regarding User Mapping from Trac

fields.description:
REST Sessions are not being terminated as they should.

h4. Steps to reproduce

*Create a session:*
{code}
curl -c cookie_jar -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"username" : "robot", "password" : "sphere"}' http://jira.mycompany.com/rest/auth/latest/session
{code}
Check that the session was created on User Sessions (_Administration > System > User Sessions)
*Delete de session:*
{code}
curl -b cookie_jar -c cookie_jar -X DELETE http://jira.mycompany.com/rest/auth/latest/session
{code}

{{atlassian-jira-security.log}} gets: 

{noformat}
http-bio-8080-exec-23 robot 831x3311x1 122gu4p 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/auth/latest/session HttpSession [122gu4p] destroyed for 'robot'
http-bio-8080-exec-23 robot 831x3311x1 122gu4p 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/auth/latest/session The user 'robot' has logged out.
{noformat}

The session will be terminated, but not destroyed as described in the REST Endpoint:

bq. Logs the current user out of JIRA, destroying the existing session, if any.

The session will be present until it reaches JIRA's session timeout (which by default is 5 hours.).

It can also be confirmed by checking on Tomcat's Manager:

!Screen Shot 2014-10-03 at 2.20.37 PM.png!
The first row on the screenshot should not be there.
fields.summary: REST Sessions not being destroyed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40272].
  {panel}

In case you link two FishEye instances in JIRA, they will have the same name which can confuse users (please refer screenshot below). It's also not possible to change the instance name in FishEye.

I've attempted to update the FishEye instance name for the Application Navigator in JIRA Database as per the KB below, but unfortunately even after updating the row and restarting JIRA the change is not reflected.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Removing+Application+Navigator+entry+from+Database

Thanks!

Luciano
fields.summary: Ability to rename a FishEye instance name on the JIRA Application Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40271].
  {panel}

h3. Description
When creating a 'Project Management' project; the issue type scheme, workflow schemes and screen scheme defaults back to 'Simple Issue Tracker' schemes.

h3. Replication
# Create a project of type 'Project Management'
# Go to *Project Administration* and check the schemes. It will show 'Simple Issue Tracker'

h3. Expected Results
Schemes should be showing as 'Project Management' schemes

h3. Actual results
Schemes are following 'Simple Issue Tracker' default schemes

h3. Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Project Management project schemes defaulting back to Simple Issue Tracker scheme on creation
JIRA to push notifications on mobile

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
- Setup LDAP directory in JIRA
- Set synchronization interval to 1 min - the interval shouldn't make a difference, this is just to reproduce it quickly.
- Let the scheduled sync run a few times to confirm it works
- Trigger a manual synchronization

h3. Expected results
- The scheduled sync starts up again based on defined synchronization interval

h3. Actual results
- The scheduled sync does not fire again

h4. Workaround
- 'Edit' the external directory in JIRA and save the configuration without making any changes should bring back the scheduled sync
fields.summary: Manually triggering a user directory synchronization breaks subsequent synchronizations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40268].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Using the attached CSV file and config file perform: Issues (upper menu) >> Import Issues From CSV.
# Using the same files perform: System >> External System Import >> Import from Comma-separated values (CSV)

*Expected Results:*
# Both issues are imported and the time tracking is the same.

*Actual Results:*
# Time tracking on the issue imported using Import Issues From CSV feature is miscalculated.

*Workaround:*
* If you are admin, use only the External System Import.

*Notes:*
* Please see attachments.
fields.summary: Import Issues from CVS does not calculate Estimated and Remaining time properly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40267].
  {panel}

Hi!

If you do frequent releases and want to use Release Notes from JIRA (which is really good method) then it's very annoying to go thru a number of clicks every time I want to copy release notes.

A few suggestions/ideas:
1) make default Release Notes format (text/html) configurable per user / project.
2) make release notes in either format accessible under 2 links. So it would take just one click to see these
3) make release notes available as a tab in a version's view in JIRA.

Thanks for very good software otherwise! You, Atlassian guys, are role models for use at MageFlow!

br,
Sven,
CTO
fields.summary: Make version Release Notes format configurable

fields.description:
h4. Summary
When the *Sidebar* dark feature is enabled in JIRA, user will not be able to open any JIRA Agile board

h4. Steps to Reproduce
There are a two way which the issue could be reproduced:
* Retrieve a JIRA Cloud backup and restore it into the latest JIRA version
* Enable JIRA Dark Feature:
*# Access JIRA with this address http://YOUR.JIRA.COM/secure/admin/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa
*# Enable this Dark Feature {{com.atlassian.jira.projects.ProjectCentricNavigation}}

h4. Expected Results
JIRA Agile board is loading without problem, and Sidebar is rendered properly
!Sidebar.png|thumbnail!

h4. Actual Results
Unable to access JIRA Agile board, and hit into this error in the UI:
{code}
An error occurred whilst rendering this message.
Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug.
Details: -------
org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getSidebarHtml' in class com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.RapidBoardAction threw exception java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.jira.projects.api.sidebar.ProjectSidebarRenderer.render(Lcom/atlassian/jira/project/Project;Ljava/lang/String;)Ljava/lang/String;
at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:greenhopper-webactions//templates/greenhopper/web/board/rapid/rapid-board.vm[line 39, column 17]
at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.handleInvocationException(ASTMethod.java:351)
at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.execute(ASTMethod.java:284)
at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.execute(ASTReference.java:262)
at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.render(ASTReference.java:342)
at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.SimpleNode.render(SimpleNode.java:336) at org.apache.velocity.Template.merge(Template.java:328)
at org.apache.velocity.Template.merge(Template.java:235)
at org.apache.velocity.app.VelocityEngine.mergeTemplate(VelocityEngine.java:381)
at com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager.writeEncodedBodyImpl(DefaultVelocityManager.java:117)
at com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager.writeEncodedBody(DefaultVelocityManager.java:97)
at com.atlassian.jira.template.velocity.DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine$DefaultRenderRequest.toWriterImpl(DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine.java:146)
at com.atlassian.jira.template.velocity.DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine$DefaultRenderRequest.asHtml(DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine.java:134)
at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraVelocityViewDispatcher.dispatch(JiraVelocityViewDispatcher.java:50)
at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.dispatchViaVelocityView(JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.java:110)
{code}

h4. Notes
This feature is available in JIRA Agile Cloud. But JIRA Agile Server unable to render the feature properly
Related KB: [method 'getSidebarHtml' java.lang.NoSuchMethodError when accessing JIRA Agile|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/method+'getSidebarHtml'+java.lang.NoSuchMethodError+when+accessing+JIRA+Agile]

h4. Workaround
Please disable the Sidebar Dark Feature by:

# Navigating to JIRA with this address http://YOUR.JIRA.COM/secure/admin/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa 
# Disable this Dark Feature {{com.atlassian.jira.projects.ProjectCentricNavigation}}

If the problem remains after removing the dark feature, some users may have opted to use the new Navigation mode through a banner suggestion, so we'll need to remove their opt-in directly from the database with the following steps:
# (!) *Create a backup of JIRA's database or an XML Backup from JIRA*
# Shutdown JIRA
# Run the following query in JIRA's database:
{code:sql}
DELETE FROM feature WHERE FEATURE_NAME like '%ProjectCentricNavigation%';
{code}
# Start JIRA
fields.summary: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError exception when accessing Sidebar Dark Feature in JIRA Agile

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40261].
  {panel}

It seems the difference between Details vs. Exclude Details in the Webhook configuration is drastic. The full detail is quite large, but the basic is not useful at all.

The basic should at least provide a reference to the JIRA issue that triggered the Webhook, and as a bonus, maybe even the event? We're receiving the user that triggered the event already.

This is all I get presently:

{code}
POST ?user_id=david&user_key=david HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8
Accept: */*
Via: 1.1 localhost (Apache-HttpClient/4.2.1-atlassian-2 (cache))
Content-Length: 7278
Host: localhost:9999
Connection: Keep-Alive
User-Agent: Atlassian HttpClient 0.17.3 / JIRA-6.3.6 (6336) / Default
{code}
fields.summary: Webhook Non-Detailed payload could be more useful

fields.description:
Enabling Copy User on Login Can Result UserAlreadyExistsException During Directory Migration if a user logs in after the directory is created. 

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a user in the internal JIRA directory with a name like jira1 and log in.
# Create a delegated LDAP Authentication directory with the Copy User on Login option ticked, and put it at the top of the directory list.
# Log back in with jira1 user.
# Attempt to migrate users from Jira Internal Directory to Delegated LDAP directory, which results in the duplicate user failure shown below.

{noformat}
Directory migration failed. Error message:
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.MembershipNotFoundException: The child entity <jira1> is not a member of the parent <jira-users>
{noformat}

*Workaround*
Once you're in the state resulting from the steps completed above—there's not an easy resolution. The following steps have been found to fix this issue *if* you have a good recent back up. 

- Restore from back up.
- Run the following database query to clear orphaned user child ids in cwd_membership {noformat}delete from cwd_membership where child_id not in (select id from cwd_user){noformat} 
- Restart JIRA
- Run directory migration.
fields.summary: UserAlreadyExistsException During Directory Migration

fields.description:
h4. Summary

The Priority field and Affect Version field and Component field when added to Issue Collector, does not rendered correctly as per the following screenshots
 !Selection_001.png|thumbnail! !Selection_002.png|thumbnail!
h4. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a project
 # Enable Issue collector in the project
 # Choose Custom form
 # Add all fields to the Create Issue screen for Issue Collector
 # Click on the dropdown for Priority and/or Affect Version and/or Components field

h4. Expected behavior

The drop down value is rendered properly for both fields.
h4. Current behavior

The fields are not rendered correctly as per the following screenshots
 !Selection_001.png|thumbnail! !Selection_002.png|thumbnail!
h4. Workaround

Change the render of the "Components" field from "Auto Complete Renderer" to "Select List Renderer". This will get this problem to work with a select list instead of the dropdown.

 

 

Many system fields do not have the option to change the renderer any longer.
fields.summary: Issue Collector Priority, Component and Version Field Not Render Correctly
Jira very slow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40247].
  {panel}

Page: 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+project+specific+security

In the first #1 on the page, the copy: 
"Create a new Permission Scheme (Administration -> Schemes -> Permission Scheme)..." 

Should be: 
Create a new Permission Scheme (Administration -> Issues -> Permission Scheme)


Took me a looooong time to find that functionality because the instructions direct users to a sub-section that does not exist. 

Low priority - just letting you know. 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Incorrect copy in security instructions
Date Picker inverts date and month when using Japanese with Chrome

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40245].
  {panel}

As a user I would like to be able to run parsing but "invalid" queries (there is a mistyped / non-visible / deleted issue key, version name, project key ...)  and still obtain "partial" results. 

As this might be a genuine mistake that the user would like to correct (a typo for instance), we should ensure that a visible warning is displayed in the UI explaining that the result set might not be complete and listing out the "invalid" values.

That way the user can opt to either "correct" the query or use the results as they are.

For some use cases, the validation errors don't really matter as the use cases are for instance: "return issues with keys including x,y,z if they exist ..." so the non-existence of one of the issues in the list is not really a problem for the user executing the query. 

Currently, the REST API exposes a {{validateQuery}} param to skip validation. When this issue is implemented, we must ensure that the behaviour of the search REST interface is consistent with the changes done under this issue.
fields.summary: Allow JQL searches via the Issue Navigator to skip validation and return partial results

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Sometimes any operations on the index, for example searching, will cease functioning. In the logs there will be an error like:

{code:none}
com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.SearchUnavailableException: com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference$InitializationException: org.apache.lucene.store.AlreadyClosedException: this IndexReader is closed
{code}

h4. Cause

The org.apache.lucene.store.AlreadyClosedException exception is not being handled correctly.

h4. Workaround

One of the following will get it working again:

# Restart JIRA
# Do a full locking re-index
fields.summary: Index stops functioning because org.apache.lucene.store.AlreadyClosedException is not handled correctly

fields.description:
When running the same query, but just changing -60m to -1h, different results will be displayed

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create an issue
# Update the issue (I updated fixversion on 17:39)
!issue.png|thumbnail!
# On 18:17, I ran all three of the following query
{code:sql}project = TEST and fixversion changed after -60m
project = TEST and fixversion changed after -1h
project = TEST and fixversion changed after -1.3h{code}

h4. Expected results
{code:sql}project = TEST and fixversion changed after -60m
project = TEST and fixversion changed after -1h{code}
Both the above code should return the same results. The updated issue should be displayed as a result because it is only less than 40minutes since I updated the issue

h4. Actual Results
When using
* -60m : The correct results are displayed
!-60m.png|thumbnail!
* -1h : No issues are displayed
!-1h.png|thumbnail!
* -1.3h: The results are displayed
!-1.3h.png|thumbnail!

h4. Notes
* Tested with JIRA 6.3.6
* -60m and -1h should display the same results. As for -1.3h, I just trial and error to see when the result will be displayed
* I tried this with Assignee instead of fixversion and the same results shows
* I tried this multiple times, the timing of when the search will show different results differed. The first time I tried, only 50 minutes later -1h won't show any results. This time I tried, it took only 40 minutes
fields.summary: JQL query: 1h and 60m does not display same results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40235].
  {panel}

When JIRA is connecting LDAP using Connector, the Display Name cannot combine 2 or more fields from LDAP. 

Reason of Requirement:
* Display Name value in LDAP does not match the current format
* editing all the user's Display Name value is not feasible

Thus, JIRA should have an option to create a new Display Name based on 2 or more fields
fields.summary: Set User Display Name from multiple LDAP attributes

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# install JIRA 5.2.x
# install JIRA Wallboard plugin version 1.9.2
# create a dashboard
# click on "View as Wallboard" and stack trace below will be thrown:
{code}
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.jira.security.JiraAuthenticationContext.getUser()Lcom/atlassian/jira/user/ApplicationUser;
	at com.atlassian.jirawallboard.servlet.WallboardServlet.doGet(WallboardServlet.java:133)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:621)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:722)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.DelegatingPluginServlet.service(DelegatingPluginServlet.java:42)
{code}

h4. root cause
JIRA Wallboard Plugin version 1.9.2 is not compatible with JIRA 5.2.x.

h4.resolution
in JIRA 5.2.x , downgrade to JIRA Wallboard plugin version 1.8.4
fields.summary: View as wallboard throws NoSuchMethodError

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40220].
  {panel}

*Hello Everyone* :)

You may have noticed that we recently changed the issuetype from "bug" to "suggestion". This does not have anything to do with the importance of the issue.

We are investing heavily in improving performance and slow initial pageloads is one of the focus areas. We've made some progress in the last quarter or two, however, as those of you with performance optimisation experience know, there are many things that contribute to the slow initial pageloads and we need to tackle a laundry list of things in order to make a substantial impact.

In the meantime, if you are experiencing slow initial page loads I'd love to hear more detail on this ticket, *so pls answer a few questions via this google form: [https://goo.gl/gnltna]*

Thanks for your help,
*Otto Ruettinger*
*Principal Product Manager, JIRA*



-----------------------------------
*Original Description*
After JIRA Cloud is restarted, which occurs once a week for the [maintenance window|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Atlassian+OnDemand+maintenance+windows] at a minimum, the very first JIRA page that is loaded can take a very long time to load.

The time can vary depending on network speed, but from Sydney it has taken up to 25 seconds to load the first page on a completely empty instance.

We've also identified that JIRA can take up to 20 seconds to load the dashboard simply if you haven't loaded JIRA for about a day.

The dashboard is the primary page that experiences slowness, however, if you visit any other page first then that page will be the slowest to load.

After the initial page load pages of different types, such as the projects page or issue navigator, may take some time on first load (up to 10 seconds during our testing, but you may experience more slowness) while the css and js are downloaded.

Once everything is cached then pages should be loading at more acceptable speeds (1-4 seconds in our testing).

If you are continuing to experience performance problems once everything is cached please log a [support ticket|https://support.atlassian.com] and provide a [HAR file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ONDEMANDKB/Generating+and+Reading+a+HAR+File+For+Performance+Troubleshooting] of your experience.

At this stage theres is no workaround, at least one user will experience slowness after a restart, once the javascript and css files are cached though then JIRA will be significantly more responsive.

Atlassian is aware of the slowness experienced by our JIRA Cloud customers, and improving the responsiveness of our applications is of utmost importance to us.
fields.summary: The first load of a JIRA Cloud page after an hour and a half of being idle takes a very long time
Excessive locking in lucene threads can lead to scalability problems in high concurrency environments

fields.description:
*Summary:* The CSV Import plugin does not appear to allow the setting of *ISSUE ID* or *PARENT ID* as per the documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Importing+Data+From+CSV

I have tried the sample from the documentation below as well as my own code.
{{IssueType, Summary, FixVersion, FixVersion, FixVersion, Component, Component, Issue ID, Parent ID, Reporter}}
{{Bug, "First issue", v1, , , Component1, , 1, , jbloggs}}
{{Bug, "Second issue", v2, , , Component1, Component2, 2, , fferdinando}}
{{Bug, "Third issue", v1, v2, v3, Component1, , 3, , fferdinando}}
{{Sub-task, "Fourth issue", v1, v2, , Component2, , , 2, jbloggs}}

Screen shots attached show the available fields.  I also typed them up below:

||JIRA fields||
|Summary|
|Issue Type|
|Component/s|
|Description|
|Reporter|
|Fix Version/s|
|Priority|
|Labels|
|Environment|
|Affects Version/s|
|Due Date|
|Asignee|
|Origional Estimate|
|Remaining Time|
|Time Spent|


This functionality "should" exist but I do not seem to have it.  I need to be able to import issues by specific ID so that my source code inter-linking works correctly. And so that I can have subtasks.

_I was unsure if reporting this here is correct, however, the IMPORT JIRA did not allow me to create an issue -> so here you go!_
fields.summary: CSV Importer doesn't seem to allow to assign IssueKey as per documentation

fields.description:
If you change any flags setting two-legged oauth, or change the impersonation flag, then the opposite side of the link is not updated to match this. This means you can create situations where the configuration is actually mismatched to the point that it breaks the application link.

For example:

# Set up an application link with default settings and "The servers have the same set of users and usernames" to produce an OAuth configuration with 2LO and impersonation enabled
# Remove impersonation from the incoming authentication configuration of either or both ends of the link
# The link is now broken

After the link is broken this way, if you make any change whatsoever to the link, it will not be reflected on the other side. This includes deleting the link not trying to delete the other side of the link.

As long as the flags remain compatible, however, if you disable or enable the entire OAuth section, it will be correctly reflected in the other side of the link.
fields.summary: Updating 2LO and 2LOi flags on incoming authentication does not update corresponding outgoing authentication on opposite site of link and vice versa

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40183].
  {panel}

Our users bristle at the thought of changing their JIRA password because of the unfriendly nature of the "Reset Password" page (ResetPassword!default.jspa)

This request entails:
# can the reset page discover the password complexity rules
# have those rules be enforced on the page, graying out the "submit" button if a password does not meet those rules

We get so many emails from frustrated users that this enhancement would certainly help alleviate the angst for our JIRA users.

An example of a "happy" user: 
{panel}
The ***** JIRA has literally the worst login & forgot your password flow I've ever encountered. I want to kill someone after using it, it's so shitty. Let me give you just the bare minimum set of features that are broken: 
1) No visibility into why already-working passwords have broken. 
2) The login link sent in a FYP email SAYS it works for 24 hours, but in reality works for exactly ONE try. 
3) The requirements for password strength are ridiculous for an internal tool. Especially when combined with bug #2. 
4) Even after resetting correctly, I can't fucking login. I can cut & paste the EXACT form entry, and it won't work. I can manually type it in, in case there's some ridiculous restriction on cut & pasting, and login credentials are still rejected. 

Please fix this festering pile of crap. If it weren't for the fact that useful data is only available in this bug tracker, I'd never use it again. Luckily for JIRA, it has a captive audience, so I can't leave with my wallet. 
{panel}
fields.summary: Enforce password complexity on the reset password page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40177].
  {panel}

Currently we have [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS] in our documentation with a thorough explanation with steps on how to use JIRA over SSL.

We also have inside the $JIRA_INSTALL/conf/server.xml file a commented text with 4 steps on how to do that that seems much simpler/faster than the steps in the page.
{quote}
To run JIRA via HTTPS:

             * Uncomment the Connector below
             * Execute:
                 %JAVA_HOME%\bin\keytool -genkey -alias tomcat -keyalg RSA (Windows)
                 $JAVA_HOME/bin/keytool -genkey -alias tomcat -keyalg RSA  (Unix)
               with a password value of "changeit" for both the certificate and the keystore itself.
             * If you are on JDK1.3 or earlier, download and install JSSE 1.0.2 or later, and put the JAR files into
               "$JAVA_HOME/jre/lib/ext"
             * Restart and visit https://localhost:8443/
{quote}

Is there any difference in using the documentation page method or the commented method?
If the method in the server.xml file is somehow not recommended, should we keep it there?
fields.summary: JIRA over SSL configuration documentation

fields.description:
The notification helper does not check to see if a JIRA user has the JIRA User global permission. 
* Not having this permission causes notifications to silently fail

h5. Symptoms

Notification helper says that a user should receive notifications but no notifications are sent to this user.

When debug mail logging is enabled the following appears in the logs despite the message not being sent:

{noformat}
2014-08-01 20:07:50,370 http-bio-8080-exec-2 DEBUG localadmin 1207x36776x1 1rolk0r 192.168.56.1 /rest/api/2/issue/ASD-150/comment [atlassian.mail.queue.MailQueueImpl] Queued: com.atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem@40816f3b[issue=com.atlassian.jira.issue.IssueImpl@71751fe6[id=125810,summary=Test,key=ASD-150,created=2014-08-01 19:19:22.489,updated=2014-08-01 20:06:10.541,assignee=unassigned:1,reporter=USER:1],remoteUser=localadmin:1,notificationType=Current_Reporter,eventTypeId=6,templateId=6]
2014-08-02 01:07:52,906 http-bio-8080-exec-3 DEBUG localadmin 1207x36779x1 1rolk0r 192.168.56.1 /secure/admin/MailQueueAdmin.jspa [atlassian.mail.queue.MailQueueImpl] Sending: com.atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem@40816f3b[issue=com.atlassian.jira.issue.IssueImpl@71751fe6[id=125810,summary=Test,key=ASD-150,created=2014-08-01 19:19:22.489,updated=2014-08-01 20:06:10.541,assignee=unassigned:1,reporter=USER:1],remoteUser=localadmin:1,notificationType=Current_Reporter,eventTypeId=6,templateId=6]
{noformat}

The message will also show in the mail queue in the UI and does not send out when the queue is flushed. No errors are logged.
fields.summary: Notification helper does not verify user has JIRA User global permission

fields.description:
Supported Platforms page indicates that PostgreSQL is supported, but the db version has to match the driver version:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms
* 9.3 with thePostgreSQL Driver 9.3.x
* 9.2 with thePostgreSQL Driver 9.2.x
* 9.1 with thePostgreSQL Driver 9.1.x
* 9.0 with thePostgreSQL Driver 9.0.x
* 8.4 with thePostgreSQL Driver 8.4.x

JIRA Standalone only comes bundled with postgresql-9.0-801.jdbc4.jar. Does this mean that if a customer does not have PostgreSQL 9.0.x, they need to download the correct jdbc driver to have a supported environment?
* If so, then we should update the setup docs to include instructions for this:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+PostgreSQL
** The existing message indicates that it's only for EAR/WAR
* If not, the Supported Platforms page should be updated to clear up this misunderstanding.
fields.summary: PostgreSQL Driver Documentation Confusing

fields.description:

Looks like Outlook 2007 has a limitation of characters and even when that is reached, it does not breaks the text properly.

There are two screenshots attached to this case that show the problem

*Steps to reproduce*

- Add text to a custom field
- Open the issue edited notification in Outlook 2007
fields.summary: Text not breaking properly in Outlook 2007

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
1. Setup an SMTP Server in JIRA Administration > System > Outgoing Mail.
2. Setup the JIRA Server to be a Private Server in JIRA Administration > System > General Configuration. Click the "Edit Settings" button, and change the Mode to "Private".
3. In this same screen, scroll down to Options: Contact Administrators Form, and change the radio button to "On".
 _At this point, the Login Screen will show the words "JIRA Administrators" to be hyperlinked to the Contact Site Administrators message screen._
4. Disable or Delete your SMTP Server.
5. Logout, and then go back to the Login screen. The link for "JIRA Administrators" is still active. When you click on it, you receive the error "You JIRA administrator has not yet configured this contact form." message appears.

*Expected Results:*
To have had the system turn off the Contact Administrators form from the General Configuration screen when the SMTP Server was disabled, and for the "JIRA Administrators" link to be Inactive, as it was before.

*Actual Results:*
There is validation for turning the Contact Administrators form to "On" to make sure that Outgoing Mail is Enabled, but there isn't any validation for deleting/disabling the Outgoing Mail and how that would impact the Contact Administrators form.

*Workaround:*
Either turn off the Contact Administrators form, or re-enable Outgoing Mail.
fields.summary: Login screen JIRA Administrators link still active after deleting/disabling outgoing mail

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40166].
  {panel}

My impression of JIRA is that it provides some limitations due to its long history. Therefore one should think about some concepts and how to improve them. 

*Versions*
A version is an attribute, it may last from start to end. At the end it will provide a release note.
On the other hand, during practical work, a version follows a workflow. At the beginning the content of the version has to be defined. Various dates have to be fixe: start of development, efford, end of development, start of testing, end of testing, same for integration and then go to production. So the content of a version is much more, than the current schema is able to solve. 
Why not think about a version as a issue of type Version. It may provide a workflow, users can adopt it to their needs. So the idea of converting an attribute to an issue can provide much more flexibility as provided today. Existing concepts in JIRA would support this idea. There would be also the possibility to decompose a Version with "Development Phase", "Test Phase" to add the timeline required of the corresponding teams. 
I see a simple functionality as precondition: One should be able to define post actions, conditions on sets of transitions. E.g. disable a transition as long there are issues not in step xyz. It should also be possible to transition other issues by post functions. E.g. For go live, I want to transition all solved issues (linked to the version) to the step "Live". 

*Links*
There is no semantic behind links. A link can express specific information, a test case refers to a requirement, also a bug should refer one ore more requirements as justification, otherwise one should create a change request. Also a change request should link to requirements it affects. It should be possible to calculate information based on sets of linked issues. E.g. "Development Phase" recieves an "Estimated Efford" from all linked "Development Tasks". 

*Durable and project issues*
A requirement lives much longer as projects changing the product. So one could distinghuish issues which are descriptive like test plan, test case or requirement. Other issues exist temporarily during phases of a project. These issues may have strong relations, because the project issues change, create or delete the durable issues. This can be understood as issues reflecting the state of the product, which may be changed by several projects in parallel. 

*Realistic Workflow for large environments*
There is a great difference between the workflow of artefacts like issues and the workflow of some kind of tasks in a project. E.g. Since there may be many customers, one would like to separate the issues in customer related projects. The development is controlled by development projects. If the customer raises an issue (bug, new requirement, ...) the overall workflow will require to create one or more development tasks in the corresponding developer project. At the moment I do not see any functionality suporting this level. 

My thoughts may be not concrete enough to start directly an implementation on it. But I want to tell, that I see a lot of gaps in the product.
fields.summary: JIRA generalisation
Disabling the 'Create issue' pop-up window via UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40164].
  {panel}

It seems that JQL editor has a preference on completing project names instead of project keys in JQL queries.

While this was probably seen as a feature that could make the JQL easier to read, in fact is a bug because the change of the JQL to become broken is probably 100x bigger when they are using project names.

Project names could change because the business decides to rename the project, or because the admins decide to improve the project name in order to help users find the projects easier. 

Any change in the project name would break all JQLs that are using it.

If the JQL would use project key this would almost never happen as changing the project key was impossible until recent versions, and even now is not something that would be done easily.

For this reason I do think that JQL editor should favour usage of project keys inside JQL editor instead of project names.
fields.summary: prevent JQL editor from completing project names instead of project keys

Reproduction steps:
# Set up a read/write ldap directory in JIRA (for example OpenDS)
# Try to add user to this directory using JIRA
# When the operation fails with a {{PermissionException}} or a {{CreateException}} these errors are ignored and browser navigates to non-existing user page.

The exceptions are not being logged anywhere, it's only possible to track it down by checking LDAP logs.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40158].
  {panel}

It seems time (estimates and tracking) is not really handled very well across main task and sub tasks. Perhaps I'm just missing some logic here so feel free to enlighten me. 

First: I have tried the fields Progress and ∑ Progress, but "Field 'progress' is not searchable, it is only sortable"

If a main task has been estimated, defining hours on sub-tasks will add hours to the total on main issue. I'd normally expect this to be detailing of that total, meaning hours should be moved to the subtask from main task. 
If all estimates are defined on sub-tasks and someone logs hours on the main task it immediately ends up on my overrun-report (workratio >100). I'd expect the workratio to calculate from the overall progress.
fields.summary: Time tracking handling with sub-tasks

Attached is a screenshot of the difference between the default JIRA logo (left) and a uploaded custom image of an jira logo uploaded as a custom image and auto reduced size (right) for comparison

As a resolution It would be nice to have JIRA OnDemand use higher resolution custom and default images. Or at least match the Default image resolution.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40139].
  {panel}

I think allowing the new awesome project re-index function to Project Admins would be a great enhancement.

My use-case is:
I have plugins that are configurable by the Project Admins. Some of these plugins will require a re-index to work as expected and today the Project Admins have to email the JIRA Admin requesting this re-index. This is an un-necessary and inefficient step in my opinion.

If this also could be configurable globally whether Project Admins shall be able to do this it would be great!

And if you could maybe even define what projects shall have this possibility it would add even more value! 

Are there any technical reasons for not allowing this?

Cheers,
// Svante
fields.summary: Allow project re-index for Project Admins

fields.description:
With a standard user/developer after clicking the drop down, takes to a 'does not have permission to access this page.' so that's good.

Seems it already requires jira administrator? just documentation needs updated? or also require bulk change?

(It's ok to have it still in drop down even if don't have permission, so people know it's possible.)

Import Issues from CSV (plugin) in Jira 6.3.3 via Jira Importers Plugin 6.2.3 correctly requires Create Issue permission, however it should also require Bulk Change permission (seems to already require jira administrator permission.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40137].
  {panel}

I maintain that the Scheme Tools functionality "doesn't add value for our users". is just wrongI found it very valuable.

We recently embarked on an effort to clean up duplicate Schemes, Workflows, etc. And when I discovered the tools I realized this was going to be a far easier effort than I'd feared. Ironically, Atlassian removed the tools literally a day or two after I started using them.

I understand why the JIRA Classic prototype has been removed. After all, "[removing the duplication to avoid confusion" is what we're trying to do with our Schemes and Workflows. And the Project Management type provides the same functionality, so nothing is lost to the user.

But the Scheme Tools don't duplicate any other functionality and nothing has been provided to replace them. If Atlassian believes these tools don't add value, they are wrong. Customers who don't use them will ignore them. 

Customers who do use them (like me) see that they DO add value. I don't see how the removal benefits anyone, but how it makes things more difficult for some customers is clear. Please make sure that whoever is in charge knows this. If they would care to contact me directly, I'd appreciate it.
fields.summary: Bring back Scheme Tools
JS error on dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40135].
  {panel}

Our customer is running JIRA on Japanese.
In Japanese, text file most popular encoding is Shift-JIS. Because the text file is encoded by Shift-JIS at default on Windows.
When Japanese text file attached to JIRA issue, it displayed on jira  the text file is mojibake. Mojibake reason is different encoding. JIRA's encoding is UTF-8, but Japanese text file is encoded by Shift-JIS.
If JIRA will support the Shift-JIS encoding, Japanese text file will not mojibake. And other Japanese encoding problems will be able to clear, too.

Thank you for your consideration.
fields.summary: Can JIRA supported Shift-JIS encoding?
